qas.question: Who developed the first commercial broadcast automation audio compression system?
Who was an engineering professor at the University of Buenos Aires?
What was launched in 1987 under the name Audicom?
Who developed the first commercial broadcast automation band?
Who was an broadcast professor at the University of Buenos Aires?
What was launched in 1987 under the name Bonello?
On what computer did Bonello develop a practical commercial on?
When was the principle of compression first published?

context: The world's first commercial broadcast automation audio compression system was developed by <a0_0><a1_0><b3_0><b4_0>Oscar Bonello<b4_0/><b3_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/>, an engineering professor at the University of Buenos Aires. In 1983, using the psychoacoustic principle of the masking of critical bands first published in <b7_0>1967<b7_0/>, he started developing a practical application based on the recently developed <b6_0>IBM PC<b6_0/> computer, and the <a2_0><b5_0>broadcast automation system<b5_0/><a2_0/> was launched in 1987 under the name Audicom. Twenty years later, almost all the radio stations in the world were using similar technology manufactured by a number of companies.
